intro: Draba nelsonii, commonly known as Nelson's whitlow grass, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many mustard plants. This species is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that bloom in early spring. Draba nelsonii typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its low-growing habit and ability to withstand harsh environmental conditions make it a resilient member of its ecosystem.
